definition: Yu Shun, one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4]
surname Yu
to expect/to anticipate/to worry/to cheat
Shun (c. 23rd century BC), mythical sage and leader

sentences.english: Shun made the official announcement of their mission within the state, because he wants everyone to embrace his orders.
sentences.chinese: 虞舜在國內告誡民衆，是爲了使人們理解他的命令。

sentences.english: Yu Shun was the one of the Five Rulers in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 虞舜是我國曆史上著名的“五帝”之一。

definition: Shun (c. 23rd century BC), mythical sage and leader

one of the five legendary emperors, also called 嚳|喾[Ku4]
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping, and writing

Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC) mythical leader who tamed the floods
alternative name for the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝
three sovereigns 三皇[san1 huang2] and five emperors 五帝[wu3 di4] of myth and legend/the earliest system of Chinese historiography
